title: Just got a punishment on my account for a single game.
body:

Yes, people will. Because you were given two "lighter" punishments as a warning to change your behavior, and you did not listen to them and continued to break the rules. I called him delusional because he was calling my duo dogshit for missing his stun which he didn't do, he actually hit a 3 man stun.  Seems like a pretty normal thing to say to somebody that is being a complete dickwad.  And although I said ff15 go next, I still played the game out.   You're telling me that if I play like 50 games with no problems after my chat restriction, but then in one game suggest in chat that we should forfeit, that is bad enough behavior to deserve a 14 day ban?  Is this really the super toxic behavior Riot needs to be cracking down on?

It does not matter what other players are doing to you - the rules do not change simply because "they started it".

If you behave like this only 50 games after a chat restriction, that means that in **2%** of your games you're being toxic. That's not acceptable. No, it's not the "super toxic" behavior. But it is still not acceptable and toxic, and you have been given 2 prior warnings that this sort of behavior is not acceptable.

You need not agree with the rules - you're free to disagree. But if you wish to not be permanently banned, you need to follow the rules after your 14 day suspension ends.

My point is that the rules suck and should be changed.  Context of the chat should matter, especially in cases like this, and the severity of the punishment shouldn't just arbitrarily ramp up like this.  I'd argue that a player who gets upset with their teammates 1 in every 50 games isn't unacceptable, but HUMAN.  In fact, I might even argue that somebody like that is a fucking saint.  This game is incredibly frustrating, just like any game.  Getting frustrated when things go poorly in something that is relatively high stakes and takes a lot of time to accomplish is completely reasonable, and punishing people for losing their cool a little bit is just the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard of.  I never personally attack anybody, I never say anything particularly obscene or inappropriate to my teammates.  Pretty much everything I say is justified within the context of the game, and literally the only reason you're saying I deserve it is because I got a little upset.  I mean I've had people literally call me racial slurs in game.  There are definitely cases where players should definitely be banned from playing, but arguing with your teammates every once in a while shouldn't be one of them.

You are free to have that opinion.

Over 80% of players never get a single chat restriction. It's human to get upset/frustrated - but you are also expected to have **self control** and not take it out on your teammates/others in the game.

As I said, you are free to have these opinions - but the rules aren't going to change just because you don't want to follow them.

"for a single game"

You weren't punished for misbehaving in one game. You were punished for misbehaving in _one more_ game, in a consistent pattern of negative behavior that breaks the game's rules. Additionally, the reform card doesn't always show all the matches that led to your punishment: it randomly selects up to several matches. You might see three matches, but you also might see as few as one, even for players whose punishment stems not from a small number of egregious infractions but rather from dozens of instances of mild toxicity. The purpose of the reform card is to tell you how to reform, so it shows you an example of the behavior that prompted your punishment and explains that such behavior is inappropriate and should be avoided if you want to maintain an account in good standing.

My guess is that you were punished for giving up ("ff15 go next"), insulting ("ur delusional"), and using chat exclusively for arguing, bossing people around, and bickering when they don't do what you tell them to do.

I would guess a chat restrict, but idk your punishment history. Idk how much you know about the system but there are tiers of punishments. It goes 10 game CR, 25 game CR, 14 day BAN, permaban. So if you've already had a 10 game cr, this would give you a 25 game cr. If youve already had a 25 game CR, you will get a 14 day ban for this. If youre wondering what you did to break the rules, constantly nagging about players playing poorly and basically blaming them for losing, is against the rules. Hope this helps!

So i can be punished for using chat to "boss people around", but I can be honored for being a "shotcaller".  What exactly is the difference between the two?  What if they had listened to me and it went well.  We win the game off those fights.  My chat would literally be identical in the parts where I'm "bossing them around", expect the outcome is we win the game.  Am I still toxic for trying to call out strategy in chat?

Bossing people around is negative. You're talking like you're "above" them. Like you're their, well, *boss*.

Shotcalling is *teamwork*. It's discussing with your team. It's providing information about the enemy whereabouts. It's **constructive**.

You don't get to defend you being rude in your chat just because "they weren't listening". They aren't obligated to listen to you. It's your job to justify your shotcalling so that others are willing to listen - this means you need to discuss, provide reasoning, and if they disagree, you don't get to force them.
